{"title":"Section 2, Page 15","subjec":{},"descri":{},"creato":{},"publis":{},"date":{},"year":{},"format":{},"reposi":{},"collec":{},"reposa":{},"rights":{},"digitb":{},"langua":{},"topics":{},"cite":{},"notes":{},"notesa":{},"source":{},"box":{},"folder":{},"identi":{},"relati":{},"findin":{},"catalo":{},"type":{},"full":"15
say it was a capital speech, not only because it was delivered at the capital, but because the newspapers of that day so
characterized it; and I always believe the newspapers,especially when they praise my friends or myself. But I never
heard that the Governor had granted the prayer of the memorialists : although I would be as likely to hear of it as any
body else, for I happened to be chairman of that committee.
But as we have received no answer, and as silence gives consent, I still indulge in the pleasing hope that the Governor
will call an extra session in December, which can run into
the regular session, This will give the legislature three
month's session ; whereas, otherwise, they could sit but for
sixty days.
The sixth resolution provides that the committee shall
frame a provisional act of incorporation, and apply to the
police jury of each parish and to the municipal authorities in
New Orleans for such sums as may be needed to defray the
expenses contemplated by the fourth resolution. This manner of proceeding is not new. As to the system of acting
under a provisional charter, it is adopted by other projected
companies here and in England. There, slock is often worth
a premium before Parliament has granted a charter.
In regard to the application for funds to the police juries
and municipal authorities it is not without precedent. The
city of New Orleans, with piompt liberality, granted $2,500
for the surveys of another road, and the police jury of the
parish of St. Landry generously anticipating our application
for aid, has already donated $500 for the survey of this very
road. It is not doubted that others will go and do like-tcise.
The seventh resolutions is as follows :—
"That when the company shall be incorporated and organized, said committee shall resign their trust, and place
the said surveys and estimates, with an account of their
